questions.question_text:
An administrator is provisioning one search head prior to installing ES.
What are the reference minimum requirements for OS, CPU, and RAM for that machine?

discussion.content:
Actually all are wrong Answers.
If its a typo mistake then its D (64 -Bit, 32 GB RAM, 16 Core CPU)

Selected Answer: D
Should be D with GB
C is correct C. OS: 64 bit, RAM: 12 MB, CPU: 16 cores
D should be correct if 32GB RAM instead of 32MB. Due to the typo, all answers are incorrect.

comments.content: Everything I can find on min recommendations for SH say 12GB, and I can't find any special instructions for ES or anything that says 32. Wouldn't that be C?

discussion.content: D is correct
none of the above should be the answer, closest match being D except MB - should have been GB

@adem & ksey:
So the RAM is actually 32GB NOT 32MB (mentioned 32MB in Answer).
As oksey mentioned, the answer is D. Ref: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/ES/6.4.0/Install/DeploymentPlanning
CPU 16 Core, 32G Ram size
The Ans is D

choices.D: OS: 64 bit, RAM: 32 MB, CPU: 16 cores
choices.B: OS: 64 bit, RAM: 32 MB, CPU: 12 cores
choices.C: OS: 64 bit, RAM: 12 MB, CPU: 16 cores
choices.A: OS: 32 bit, RAM: 16 MB, CPU: 12 cores

discussion.content: correct answer is D authentication.

This is the search powering this dashboard, so it's a clear answer D "Authentication" :

| tstats `summariesonly` count from datamodel=Authentication.Authentication where Authentication.user=$ds_input_tokens:result.user$ $ds_input_tokens:result.remote_user_bunit$ by Authentication.src,Authentication.user | `drop_dm_object_name("Authentication")`| `get_identity4events(user)` | rename user_watchlist as watchlist | search $ds_input_tokens:result.watchlist_raw$ | `get_asset(src)` | iplocation src | eval session_city=if(isnull(src_city), City,src_city) | eval session_country=if(isnull(src_country), Country,src_country) | where isnotnull(session_city) AND isnotnull(user_work_city) AND (lower(user_work_city)!=lower(session_city) OR lower(user_work_country)!=lower(session_country)) | fields user, src, session_city, session_country, user_work_city, user_work_country | sort 100 -count

Selected Answer: D
The Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D
The correct answer is D. Verified in the Splunk ES app.
D is correct
User Activity dashboard uses multiple DM, but remote access panel is using Authentication datamodel so D is correct option.

questions.question_text:
The Remote Access panel within the User Activity dashboard is not populating with the most recent hour of data.
What data model should be checked for potential errors such as skipped searches?

choices.B: Notable event domains displayed by risk score.
choices.D: Key indicators showing the highest probability correlation searches in the environment.
choices.C: A display of the highest risk assets and identities.

questions.question_text: What tools does the Risk Analysis dashboard provide?

discussion.content: C is correct
C is correct
Answer C, page 96

C is correct
D option is for Security posture dashboard I think
I think answer is D

choices.D: Either use new app names or always include both existing and new content.
choices.C: Always include existing and new content for each export.
choices.B: Do not use the .spl extension when naming an export.
choices.A: Use new app names each time content is exported.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: D
Either use new app names each time (which could be difficult to manage) or make sure you always include all content (old and new) each time you export.

Ref: Administering Splunk Enterprise Security, Page 286.

Selected Answer: D
Either use new app names each time (which could be difficult to manage) or make sure you always include all content (old and new) each time you export 
ref : admin ES 6.6 page 238
D is correct
